text: Thomas K. Delahanty (born c. 1934) is a retired District of Columbia Metropolitan Police Department officer who was wounded during the assassination attempt on U.S. President Ronald Reagan on March 30, 1981, in Washington, D.C.. Washington Post, "25th Anniversary: Reagan's Brush With Death," "Feeling 'Great,' President Leaves the Hospital: Reagan Returns to the White House But Work Schedule Still Limited," Lee Lescaze, Saturday, April 11, 1981. Delahanty was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:American crime victims Category:American police officers Category:People from Pittsburgh
title: Thomas Delahanty
